answers.answer: Hello.This may be the beginning of neuropathy. You have to demarcate the area where you feel the sensation. It can be correlated to a specific nerve.Do you have diabetes? Diabetes is a common cause of peripheral neuropathy.Please consult a neurologist and get this one explored.Regards

question: Why do I have the phantom feeling of something being in my sock or shoe of my right foot?  There is no pain, no numbness.  When  I go barefoot, I don't have that sensation, just when I put on my socks, I immediately can tell the difference.  I check and there is nothing in sock or shoe and no sore on ball or bottom of foot.  What is going on?
title: Right foot sensation of restriction when wearing footware
